#Text=Montreal/Quartier Latin-Le Village
#Text=Quartier Latin-Le Village is in Montreal .
#Text=It contains the Quartier Latin , Le Village , and Sainte-Marie .
#Text=Le Village

#Text=Le Village gai ( Gay Village , often shortened to Le Village ) is the largest gay village in North America , mostly along rue Sainte-Catherine est from rue Saint-Hubert ( near metro Berri-UQAM ) to avenue Papineau ( near metro Papineau ) .
#Text=The metro station in the middle of the area , Beaudry , is marked with rainbow pillars .

#Text=Come to enjoy Montreal 's pride celebration , Divers/Cité ( last week of July , first week of August ) , which is the second largest in North America after Toronto ' s. Then the Montreal Pride Parade event follows in mid-August with more fabulous fun to be had by all attendees .

#Text=Canada 's contributions to gay rights are widely known , but Quebec was the first province in Canada to pass a non-discrimination law for sexual orientation and to provide same-sex civil unions .

#Text=Same-sex marriage is legal in Quebec and across Canada ; neither residency nor citizenship are required for a marriage license , but there is a three-week waiting period after you receive the license .
#Text=Canadian and Quebec immigration law allow residents to sponsor their same-sex partners or spouses .
#Text=Sainte-Marie
#Text=Sainte-Marie is a working-class neighborhood to the east of Le Village .
#Text=It is notably the home of the Maison Radio-Canada , the radio and television broadcasting headquarters for Radio-Canada , the French language arm of the CBC .
#Text=By metro
#Text=The Orange , Green , and Yellow lines all intersect at the Berri-UQAM station , on the south edge of the Quartier .
#Text=Sherbrooke station , at the north end of the Quartier and the edge of the Plateau ( literally -- it 's a steep walk ! ) is on the Orange line .

#Text=Other Green line stations of note are Beaudry ( in the middle of the Village ) , Papineau ( at the east end of the Village near Sainte-Marie ) , and Frontenac ( in the middle of Sainte-Marie ) .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Station Centrale d'autobus de Montréal ( 505 boulevard de Maisonneuve est ) is the entry point to Montreal for those arriving by bus from out of the city .
#Text=Buses run east to west along Sherbrooke , Ontario , and Sainte-Catherine and north to south on Saint-Denis .
#Text=See
#Text=Grande Bibliothèque du Québec , 475 boul de Maisonneuve est ( at rue Berri ; metro Berri-UQAM ) , ☏ +1514 873-1100 , toll-free : +1-800-363-9028 .
#Text=Tu - F 10AM-10PM , Sa - Su 10AM-5PM .
#Text=The inviting , super-modern home to the Bibliothèque et Archives nationales du Québec , a massive library housing four million works .

#Text=The building itself is a contemporary style building integrating art and architecture including a glass mural , a kinetic luminous mural , a sculpture garden , and varying museum-style displays in the lower-level gallery .
#Text=The tiles that cover the outside of the building are made to resemble a closed book .
#Text=Architectural tours are offered .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Centre de Design UQAM ( UQAM design center ) , 1440 rue Sanguinet ( at rue de Boisbriand ; metro Berri-UQAM ) , ☏ +1514 987-3395 .
#Text=W - Su noon-6PM .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Galerie de l'UQAM ( UQAM Gallery ) , 1400 rue Berri ( at rue Sainte-Catherine , Pavillon Judith-Jasmin , Room J-R120 ; metro Berri-UQAM ) .
#Text=Tu - Sa noon-6PM .
#Text=Contemporary art exhibits , workshops , lectures , and tours .
#Text=Closed until Sep 1 , 2015 .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Écomusée du fier monde , 2050 rue Amherst ( between rue Ontario and rue Sherbrooke ; metro Sherbrooke or Beaudry ) .

#Text=A museum focused on the industrial and working-class history of Montreal ( the name literally translates to Ecomuseum of the Proud People ) , particularly of the surrounding Centre-Sud district ( basically the modern-day Le Village and Sainte-Marie neighborhoods ) .
#Text=The museum is housed in the Bain Genereux , a 1920s art deco former indoor public pool .
#Text=Note that unlike most Montreal museums , the exhibits here are only described in French .
#Text=Do
#Text=Cinémathèque québecoise , 335 boul de Maisonneuve est ( between rue Sanguinet and rue Saint-Denis ; metro Berri-UQAM ) , ☏ +1514 842-9763 .
#Text=Tu - Su regular showing 5PM , exhibition hall Tu - F 11AM-8PM and Sa - Su 4PM-8PM .
#Text=Modern theater complex with 17-screens ( most shows in French only ) , cafe , restaurant and bar .
#Text=Exhibitions free ; film screenings $ 8 adults , $ 7 seniors ( 65+)/students , $ 5 children ( 6-15 ) , free for children 5 and under .
#Text=Cinéma Cineplex
#Text=Odeon Quartier Latin
#Text=, 350 rue Émery ( between rue Sanguinet and rue Saint-Denis ; metro Berri-UQAM ) , ☏ +1514 849-2244 .
#Text=Showcases mostly mainstream Hollywood films , all dubbed in French .
#Text=general admission , $ 8.25 children and seniors .
#Text=Théâtre Saint-Denis , 1594 rue Saint-Denis ( between rue Émery and boul de Maisonneuve ; metro Berri-UQAM ) , ☏ +1514 849-4211 .
#Text=Performing arts centre with two halls .
#Text=Maison de la culture Frontenac , 2550 rue Ontario est ( between rue Frontenac and rue du Havre ; metro Frontenac , bus 85 , 94 , 125 , or 185 ) , ☏ +1514 872-7882 .
#Text=Tu - Th 1PM-7PM , F - Su 1PM-5PM .
#Text=Cultural centre in Sainte-Marie .
#Text=Many free shows .
#Text=Music , dance , cinema , theatre , etc.
#Text=Buy
#Text=Chlorophylle Montréal , 1567 rue Saint-Denis ( at boul de Maisonneuve ; metro Berri-UQAM ) , ☏ +1514 845-1712 .
#Text=M - Tu 10AM-6PM , W - F 10AM-9PM , Sa 10AM-5PM , Su 11AM-5PM .
#Text=One of two flagship ' concept stores ' for Quebec-based outdoor clothing company with shirts , coats , and pants for men , women and children .
#Text=Their environmentalism even extends to their dressing room -- made out of recycled barn sheds from Northern Quebec .
#Text=Boutique Woodstock , 2080B rue Saint-Denis ( between rue Sherbrooke and rue Ontario ; metro Sherbrooke ) , ☏ +1514 842-9562 .
#Text=One of the many head-shops along Saint-Denis with all your ' smoking accessories ' as well as hemp products including shirts , jeans , bags , and cosmetics .
#Text=Eat
#Text=The Latin Quartier is packed two and three stories deep with budget and mid-ranged restaurants catering to students and tourists .
#Text=The quality can be all over the place , but the portions usually generous .
#Text=Beer is more common than wine and be sure to check if the mid and high-end place you 're dining at is BYOB ( Apportez Votre Vins ) .
#Text=Budget
#Text=Chez Gatsé , 317 rue Ontario est ( at rue Sanguinet ; metro Sherbrooke or Berri-UQAM ) , ☏ +1514 985-2494 .
#Text=M - Th 11:30AM-2:30PM and 5:30PM-10PM , F 11:30AM-2:30PM and 5:30PM-10:30PM , Sa 5:30PM-10:30PM , Su 5PM-10PM .

#Text=Set just below eye level , one of Montreal 's only Tibetan restaurants offers momos ( Tibetan dumplings ) , butter-tea , as well as exotic vegetarian and meat dishes spiced with ginger , garlic , and peppers .
#Text=In the summer there 's a shady terrace in the back .
#Text=Mains $ 5 - 9 , set meal $ 6.50 lunch/$ 7.50 dinner .
#Text=Comptoir 21 , 1117 Saint Catherine East , ☏ +1514 507-3474 .
#Text=M - F 11:30AM-11:00PM , Sa Su 12:00AM-11:00PM .
#Text=The fish and chips restaurant offers delicious fresh fishes .
#Text=One can sit outisde on the street in the middle of the Gay Village .
#Text=Juliette Et Chocolat , 1615 rue Saint-Denis ( between boul de Maisonneuve and rue Ontario ; metro Berri-UQAM ) , ☏ +1514 287-3555 .
#Text=Su - Th 11AM-11PM , F - Sa 11AM-midnight .
#Text=While the wafting scent of chocolate may be the main draw to this chocolateria-cum-bistro , they also offer a selection of savory buckwheat crepes , soups , and salads .
#Text=Quiet during the day , things pick up in the evening when everyone stops by for coffee , fresh ice cream and coffee and , of course , gourmet chocolate to eat on the spot or take away .
#Text=Villa Frontenac , 2563 rue Ontario est ( at rue Frontenac ; metro Frontenac , bus 85 , 94 , 125 , or 185 ) , ☏ +1514 521-4233 .
#Text=Sainte-Marie diner with a large variety of plates ( local , Italian , Greek , American , fast food , etc. ) .
#Text=Breakfast $ 3 , dinner $ 6 .
#Text=Restaurant Bercy , 2600 rue Ontario est ( between rue du Havre and rue Bercy ; metro Frontenac , bus 85 , 94 , 125 , or 185 ) , ☏ +1514 525-9341 .
#Text=Cheap diner food in a strip mall in Sainte-Marie .
#Text=Breakfast $ 3 , dinner $ 7 .
